questions.q: What does the acronym HTML stand for?
questions.explanation: HTML stands for Hyper Text Markup Language [1], [2]. It is the standard markup language for creating web pages [1].

questions.q: Which type of network is usually confined to a single building or group of buildings?
questions.explanation: A LAN (Local Area Network) is a group of computers and peripheral devices connected in a limited area like a school, home, or office building [3].

questions.q: Which protocol is used by web servers to transmit web pages and multimedia files over the Web?
questions.explanation: HTTP (Hypertext Transfer Protocol) is a set of rules for exchanging files like text, images, and video on the Web [4], [5].

questions.q: How many bits long is an IP address?
questions.explanation: An IP address is a unique logical address that is 32 bits (4 bytes) long [6].

questions.q: Which HTML tag is used to define the largest heading?
questions.explanation: The <h1> tag defines the most important (largest) heading, while <h6> defines the least important [7], [8].

questions.q: To open a link in a new tab or window, which attribute and value should be added to the <a> tag?
questions.explanation: The target="_blank" attribute is used to open a linked document in a new window or tab [9], [10], [11].

questions.q: Which image attribute is required to provide alternate text if the image cannot be displayed?
questions.explanation: The alt attribute is required and provides alternate text that the browser displays if it cannot find or load the image [12], [13].

questions.q: Which list type is used to create a numbered list?
questions.explanation: An ordered list (<ol>) is used to create a numbered list, where items are incremented by one [14], [15].

questions.q: In an HTML table, which attribute is used to merge two or more columns into a single column?
questions.explanation: The colspan attribute is used to merge columns, while rowspan is used to merge rows [16], [17].

questions.q: Which form method should be used when sending sensitive or personal information?
questions.explanation: POST should always be used for sensitive data because it appends data inside the body of the HTTP request rather than showing it in the URL [18], [19].

questions.q: Which CSS property is used to create space around the content of an element, inside of any defined borders?
questions.explanation: Padding clears an area around the content inside the border, while margin clears an area outside the border [20], [21], [22].

questions.q: What is the correct CSS syntax to select elements with the class name 'menu'?
questions.explanation: Class selectors in CSS are defined with a period (.) followed by the class name [23], [24].

questions.q: Which tag is used to link an external CSS style sheet to an HTML document?
questions.explanation: External style sheets are separate .css files linked to HTML pages using the <link> tag [25], [22].

questions.q: In the CSS Box Model, which part is affected by the background color of the element?
questions.explanation: The padding is affected by the background color of the element, whereas the margin is always transparent [26], [27].

questions.q: Which role is responsible for developing both client and server software?
questions.explanation: A full stack web developer is a person who can develop both client and server software, mastering HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and server-side languages [28].
